content:
In flight booking systems, UI speed directly impacts conversion.

But not every feature in aviation can be made optimistic; seats and tickets have strict backend guarantees (GDS/NDC), so the UI must wait.

Where useOptimistic does shine is in dynamic fare upgrades:

When a traveler switches from Saver → Flex, the backend triggers:

1. A fresh pricing call

2. Availability re-validation

3. Ancillary recalculation

That can easily be 1+ seconds on a busy airport route.

With useOptimistic, we update:
✔ Price visualization
✔ Included bags and meals
✔ Change/cancellation rules

instantly — before the server responds.

If the backend returns a mismatch (e.g., fare jump), React rolls back gracefully with a notification.

Users perceive “premium upgrade” as fast and delightful.
The business sees higher upsell success.
No inventory risk.
Win-win.

React 19 isn’t just DX sugar.
It’s driving UX where every millisecond matters, especially in aviation.
